thread.title: Ex-candidate who wrote book of rants participates in debate
thread.title_full: Ex-candidate who wrote book of rants participates in debate

author: The Associated Press
title: Ex-candidate who wrote book of rants participates in debate
text:
Ex-candidate who wrote book of rants participates in debate The Associated Press Order Reprint of this Story PARAMUS, N.J. 
A Republican New Jersey Assembly candidate who dropped out of the race after his book of rants about gays and others surfaced has participated in a campaign debate anyway, saying he's not the same person he was when he wrote it. 
Anthony Cappola's 2003 book, "Outrageous," targeted gays, Muslims, blacks and seniors. 
Cappola said at Wednesday's League of Women Voters forum in Paramus he "wrote a raunchy, insensitive book." He says he's not a bigot. 
Republicans dropped a legal effort to replace Cappola because it was too expensive. 
Mark DiPisa was Cappola's Republican running mate in the 38th District. He didn't want to share a stage with him and didn't attend the debate. He issued a statement criticizing the Democratic candidates who did. 
Democratic Assemblymen Tim Eustace and Joseph Lagana say voters are entitled to hear their views. They didn't mention Cappola's book. Related content
